meanings.definition: (verb) to spread to other parts of the body
meanings.sent1: The cancer cells metastasize from the lungs to the liver.
meanings.sent2: The tumor can metastasize and affect different organs.
meanings.sent3: The rebellious ants decided to metastasize to the neighboring garden.
meanings.sent4: His negative thoughts seemed to metastasize like a wildfire in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The gossip started to metastasize through the small town, causing chaos.

meanings.sent1: The cancerous cells metastasize rapidly in advanced stages.
meanings.sent2: It is crucial to monitor how the cancer cells metastasize in the body.
meanings.sent3: The idea to throw a surprise party seemed to metastasize in her mind.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of excitement began to metastasize within the group of friends.
meanings.sent5: The joy of winning the championship started to metastasize among the team members.
